channel.title: Freedom of Coding and an Asshole's opinion
channel.description:
Well, recently I started thinking. This is kinda of out of the ordinary and random. However, using Project 64, Nestopia, And Snes9x - Which are all Emulators and multiple different versions of RSPS, I have came to one conclusion. Isn't this something that I like to call "Freedom of Coding"? For example. To make P Servers, that entails deobfuscating the client and by most means, writing a server from scratch. What law prohibits this? A law that says I can't take a Folder Or in other words, the [u][b]CACHE[/b][/u] and play around with it? I mean I didn't hack into an official Jagex server to get it. See what I mean? I can take a screen shot of that Cache, print it, and wipe my ass with it. Can't I?
Also with a Nintendo, Sega, or Playstation emulator, can't I build something all by myself and dump the Bios out of the system, go to my computer, open Visual C and write myself an emulator? What I'm trying to get across here is: Why is it such a fuss to involve lawyers with RSPS if the cache was in wL's computer when he/she went to write the first server? Or when Jabo and Zilmar decided to write an emulator, or when Lik Sang decided to found Bung enterprises which sold Rom dumpers. I know this can revenue and stuff but the things to make an emulator or and server are there and they put it there. I can go to C:\ And see the .Jagex_cache_32 and do whatever I want since it's in my computer. Right? What I think is that it's perfectly legal, can someone tell me if I'm wrong? And why?

item.title: Freedom of Coding and an Asshole's opinion
item.dc:creator: @Maedie1 Maedie1
item.description:
@Maedie1 wrote:

[quote=“Jordiescape, post:36, topic:296238”][quote author=Maedie1 link=topic=392264.msg2924067#msg2924067 date=1250906586]
Thanks a lot for that, Niall. Now, what if I decided to open some modeling program and make 7k models in the same order as the 377 cache and create textures identical to the 377 ones of RuneScape and then write a server and make everything identical? That can’t be illegal since I didn’t even use the cache.
[/quote]
Why do you use such stupid situations? Of course that is not illegal as you made every one by yourself.[/quote]
Ok, sure, Mr. “That’s how it’s wrote.” I’m not trying to flame anyone here but don’t come telling me my situation is stupid when you can’t even use write in a past tense.

Read full topic

item.source: Freedom of Coding and an Asshole's opinion

item.title: Freedom of Coding and an Asshole's opinion
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

  • The point ^ you guys

Writing your own server: not illegal
Using their protocol in your server: probably illegal
Distributing their cache: illegal(depending on where you live[1])
Distributing their client: illegal(see above)

Maedie1:

The point is, they try to sue us, when they put vulnerable things like not encrypting the chip that contains the rom or storing a cache in our computer.

I don’t know if you understand this, but the client, and (parts) at the cache have to be stored on your computer to play. But back to the argument, take for example money, it is in your possession, but that does not make it legal for you to copy it(or in some cases destroy it).

To nudge you guys back to the point, while it is illegal, jagex will probably only take legal action if you are making substantial money from it(you know, because of legal fees), they can still send cease and desist type letters though(should remind you, mopar got a few of these over 3 years ago).

[1]: If you live in a country without copyright laws, then stop whining and go download dvds or something.

Read full topic
item.source: Freedom of Coding and an Asshole's opinion

item.title: Freedom of Coding and an Asshole's opinion
item.dc:creator: @suprkwlguy123 suprkwlguy123
item.description:
@suprkwlguy123 wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:29, topic:296238”]Well its simple, all the copyrighted shit is hosted on other sites and the only illegal shit thats hosted on moparisthebest.com is the webclient and cache archives. All other shit is on uppit, mediafire etc.

On Emulators, nothing is illegal about them, its the ROMS which you have not purchased which are.[/quote]Correct.

On-Topic: It’s illegal because the servers use the same graphics, i.e. the same models, textures, and other things which are COPYRIGHTED. Using the same graphics is infringing upon their copyright, and thus, is illegal.

Read full topic
item.source: Freedom of Coding and an Asshole's opinion

item.title: Freedom of Coding and an Asshole's opinion
item.dc:creator: @Maedie1 Maedie1
item.description:
@Maedie1 wrote:

Exactly but I can take sometime and build my very own Rom dumper. I can borrow a game from Blockbuster (Back in 2001) and put it in my dumper and I can dump the rom. The point is, they try to sue us, when they put vulnerable things like not encrypting the chip that contains the rom or storing a cache in our computer. That’s like saying, Okay, Moparisthebest, take my… I don’t know… My “Java control Panel”, but don’t decompile the Class files.

Read full topic
